intro: Chuquiraga coccinosantha, commonly known as the scarlet chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Chuquiraga coccinosantha is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in high-altitude environments.
